Class NameThatTune1

  • java.lang.Object
    • NameThatTune1

  • public class NameThatTune1
extends java.lang.Object

    Create Random Music!

    The NameThatTune1 program plays randomly generated music from a text file and displays a dynamically generated visualization

    Since:
    2014-12-4

        Parameters:
        num - This is the original number that needs to be mapped
        cmin - This is the minimum value of the original range
        cmax - This is the maximum value of the original range
        nmin - This is the minimum value of the new range

      • drawNotes

        public static void drawNotes(int i,
             double duration,
             int pitch,
             float startX,
             float startY,
             int trill)
        This method is used to draw the actual notes of the sheet music
        Parameters:
        i - This is the ith note of the sequence of notes
        duration - This is the duration of that note
        pitch - This is the pitch of that note
        startX - This is the center X-position of the sheet music
        startY - This is the center Y-position of the sheet music

        pitch - This is the pitch of the note that is played
        duration - This is the duration of the note that is played

      • note

        public static double[] note(int pitch,
            int base,
            short[] ints,
            double t,
            double vol)
        This method creates a wave with harmonics for a melody note and a chord, and it combines these waves
        Parameters:
        pitch - This is the melody note
        base - This is the base of the chord
        ints - This is an array of the intervals of the chord
        t - This is the duration of the note
        vol - This is the number the original volume should be multiplied by
        Returns:
        double[] An array that generates the wave for a given note

      • delay

        public static double[] delay(int[] pitch,
             double[] duration,
             int[] ints,
             int[] basePitch)
        This method delays the music (creates an echo) that is behind by the duration of the first note.
        Parameters:
        pitch - This is an array of the original pitches
        duration - This is an array of the duration of the notes
        ints - This is the the array of their different chords
        basePitch - This is an array of the base pitch
        Returns:
        double[] an array of the y-values of the original melody and an echo combined
